page.title: 17EXCAVATIONS AT POTOVENS
page.content: In Wrenthorpe there have been a number of excavations,but on the site where the village hall used to stand there were kilns going back to 16th and 17th century.They could not raise the money to Excavate this site.The village of Potovens,now called Wrenthorpe is a mile and a half away from Wakefield.Wrenthorpe is one of the smallest villages in Yorkshire,but one of the best places to find pottery.In Wakefield museum you can see how much has been found.Under the village hall they found a large area of clay going back to the last century.They have found Roman pots and plates,and in one Excavation they found a skull and a tree.The tree was over a thousand years old.These are some of the places where they have had excavations;York,Doncaster and Huddersfield.
